definition: to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: The decimal system is a carry system widely used in the world today.
sentences.chinese: 十进位是世界上被广泛使用的进位制。

sentences.english: A positional system of numeration that uses decimal digits and a radix of10.
sentences.chinese: 使用十进位数字字和基数10记数的一种位置法。

sentences.english: Returns the largest integer less than or equal to the specified decimal number.
sentences.chinese: 传回小于或等于指定的十进位数字的最大整数。

sentences.english: Britain converted to decimal currency on February 15th, 1971.
sentences.chinese: 英国于1971年2月15日改用十进位币制。

sentences.english: In decimal form, rational numbers are either terminating or repeating decimals.
sentences.chinese: 在十进位中，有理数的位数有限，或者可以重复。

sentences.english: The result is converted to decimal log concentration.
sentences.chinese: 结果转换为十进位日志浓度。

sentences.english: There are radical differences between binary and decimal numeration.
sentences.chinese: 二进位和十进位计算有着根本的区别。

sentences.english: Rounds a decimal value to a specified precision.
sentences.chinese: 将十进位的值舍入至指定的精确度。

sentences.english: In 1971 Britain changed over to the new decimal money system.
sentences.chinese: 1971年英国改用新的十进位币制。

sentences.english: We go by the centimeter in China.
In the normal life we used to decimal computational method.
sentences.chinese: 日常生活中我们习惯使用十进位的计算方法。

sentences.english: Rounds a decimal value to a specified number of fractional digits.
sentences.chinese: 将十进位值舍入为指定的小数位数。

sentences.english: We use the centimeter (metric sys-tem) in China.
All the petrol pumps have been switched over to show decimal values.
sentences.chinese: 所有汽油加油泵现在都已改成十进位显示了。

sentences.english: Rounds a decimal value to the nearest integer.
sentences.chinese: 将十进位值舍入为指定的小数位数。

definition: to do a sum in writing/written calculation
rules of calculation (addition, subtraction, multiplication and division)/algorithm/fig. to scheme/to calculate (i.e. plot)
"quarter remainder" calendar, the first calculated Chinese calendar, dating from c. 484 BC
method of counting (e.g. decimal or Roman numbers)
